verses.verse: A good name<WH8034> is better<WH2896> than precious<WH2896> ointment;<WH4480> <WH8081> and the day<WH3117> of death<WH4194> than the day<WH4480> <WH3117> of one's birth.<WH3205>

It is better<WH2896> to go<WH1980> to<WH413> the house<WH1004> of mourning,<WH60> than to go<WH4480> <WH1980> to<WH413> the house<WH1004> of feasting:<WH4960> for<WH834> that<WH1931> is the end<WH5490> of all<WH3605> men;<WH120> and the living<WH2416> will lay<WH5414> it to<WH413> his heart.<WH3820>
Sorrow <WH3708> is better<WH2896> than laughter:<WH4480> <WH7814> for<WH3588> by the sadness<WH7455> of the countenance<WH6440> the heart<WH3820> is made better.<WH3190>
The heart<WH3820> of the wise<WH2450> is in the house<WH1004> of mourning;<WH60> but the heart<WH3820> of fools<WH3684> is in the house<WH1004> of mirth.<WH8057>
It is better<WH2896> to hear<WH8085> the rebuke<WH1606> of the wise,<WH2450> than for a man<WH4480> <WH376> to hear<WH8085> the song<WH7892> of fools.<WH3684>
For <WH3588> as the crackling<WH6963> of thorns<WH5518> under<WH8478> a pot,<WH5518> so<WH3651> is the laughter<WH7814> of the fool:<WH3684> this<WH2088> also<WH1571> is vanity.<WH1892>
Surely <WH3588> oppression<WH6233> maketh a wise man<WH2450> mad;<WH1984> and a gift<WH4979> destroyeth<WH6> <WH853> the heart.<WH3820>

Better <WH2896> is the end<WH319> of a thing<WH1697> than the beginning<WH4480> <WH7225> thereof: and the patient<WH750> in spirit<WH7307> is better<WH2896> than the proud<WH4480> <WH1362> in spirit.<WH7307>
Be not<WH408> hasty<WH926> in thy spirit<WH7307> to be angry:<WH3707> for<WH3588> anger<WH3708> resteth<WH5117> in the bosom<WH2436> of fools.<WH3684>

Say <WH559> not<WH408> thou, What<WH4100> is<WH1961> the cause that the former days<WH7945> <WH3117> <WH7223> were<WH1961> better<WH2896> than these?<WH4480> <WH428> for<WH3588> thou dost not<WH3808> inquire<WH7592> wisely<WH4480> <WH2451> concerning<WH5921> this.<WH2088>
Wisdom <WH2451> is good<WH2896> with<WH5973> an inheritance:<WH5159> and by it there is profit<WH3148> to them that see<WH7200> the sun.<WH8121>

For <WH3588> wisdom<WH2451> is a defense,<WH6738> and money<WH3701> is a defense:<WH6738> but the excellency<WH3504> of knowledge<WH1847> is, that wisdom<WH2451> giveth life<WH2421> to them that have<WH1167> it.
Consider <WH7200> <WH853> the work<WH4639> of God:<WH430> for<WH3588> who<WH4310> can<WH3201> make that straight,<WH8626> <WH853> which<WH834> he hath made crooked?<WH5791>

In the day<WH3117> of prosperity<WH2896> be<WH1961> joyful,<WH2896> but in the day<WH3117> of adversity<WH7451> consider:<WH7200> God<WH430> also<WH1571> hath set<WH6213> <WH853> the one<WH2088> over against<WH5980> the other,<WH2088> to<WH5921> the end<WH1700> that man<WH120> should find<WH4672> nothing<WH7945> <WH3808> <WH3972> after<WH310> him.

<WH853> All<WH3605> things have I seen<WH7200> in the days<WH3117> of my vanity:<WH1892> there is<WH3426> a just<WH6662> man that perisheth<WH6> in his righteousness,<WH6664> and there is<WH3426> a wicked<WH7563> man that prolongeth<WH748> his life in his wickedness.<WH7451>
Be <WH1961> not<WH408> righteous<WH6662> over much;<WH7235> neither<WH408> make thyself over wise:<WH2449> <WH3148> why<WH4100> shouldest thou destroy thyself?<WH8074>
Be not<WH408> over much<WH7235> wicked,<WH7561> neither<WH408> be<WH1961> thou foolish:<WH5530> why<WH4100> shouldest thou die<WH4191> before<WH3808> thy time?<WH6256>

It is good<WH2896> that<WH834> thou shouldest take hold<WH270> of this;<WH2088> yea, also<WH1571> from this<WH4480> <WH2088> withdraw<WH5117> not<WH408> <WH853> thine hand:<WH3027> for<WH3588> he that feareth<WH3373> God<WH430> shall come forth<WH3318> <WH853> of them all.<WH3605>
Wisdom <WH2451> strengtheneth<WH5810> the wise<WH2450> more than ten<WH4480> <WH6235> mighty<WH7989> men which<WH834> are<WH1961> in the city.<WH5892>
For <WH3588> there is not<WH369> a just<WH6662> man<WH120> upon earth,<WH776> that<WH834> doeth<WH6213> good,<WH2896> and sinneth<WH2398> not.<WH3808>
Also <WH1571> take<WH5414> no<WH408> heed<WH3820> unto all<WH3605> words<WH1697> that<WH834> are spoken;<WH1696> lest<WH834> <WH3808> thou hear<WH8085> <WH853> thy servant<WH5650> curse<WH7043> thee:
For <WH3588> oftentimes<WH7227> <WH6471> also<WH1571> thine own heart<WH3820> knoweth<WH3045> that<WH834> thou thyself<WH859> likewise<WH1571> hast cursed<WH7043> others.<WH312>
All <WH3605> this<WH2090> have I proved<WH5254> by wisdom:<WH2451> I said,<WH559> I will be wise;<WH2449> but it<WH1931> was far<WH7350> from<WH4480> me.
That which is<WH4100> <WH7945> <WH1961> far off,<WH7350> and exceeding deep,<WH6013> <WH6013> who<WH4310> can find it out?<WH4672>

I <WH589> applied<WH5437> mine heart<WH3820> to know,<WH3045> and to search,<WH8446> and to seek out<WH1245> wisdom,<WH2451> and the reason<WH2808> of things, and to know<WH3045> the wickedness<WH7562> of folly,<WH3689> even of foolishness<WH5531> and madness: <WH1947>

And I<WH589> find<WH4672> more bitter<WH4751> than death<WH4480> <WH4194> <WH853> the woman,<WH802> whose<WH834> <WH1931> heart<WH3820> is snares<WH4685> and nets,<WH2764> and her hands<WH3027> as bands:<WH612> whoso pleaseth<WH2896> <WH6440> God<WH430> shall escape<WH4422> from<WH4480> her; but the sinner<WH2398> shall be taken<WH3920> by her.
Behold, <WH7200> this<WH2088> have I found,<WH4672> saith<WH559> the preacher,<WH6953> counting one<WH259> by one,<WH259> to find out<WH4672> the account: <WH2808>

Which <WH834> yet<WH5750> my soul<WH5315> seeketh,<WH1245> but I find<WH4672> not:<WH3808> one<WH259> man<WH120> among a thousand<WH4480> <WH505> have I found;<WH4672> but a woman<WH802> among all<WH3605> those<WH428> have I not<WH3808> found.<WH4672>

Lo, <WH7200> this<WH2088> only<WH905> have I found,<WH4672> that<WH834> God<WH430> hath made<WH6213> <WH853> man<WH120> upright;<WH3477> but they<WH1992> have sought out<WH1245> many<WH7227> inventions.<WH2810>
